HomePage.title: Foreign Investment Property Fee Calculator
HomePage.subtitle: Calculate your property investment costs with confidence
HomePage.description: Our advanced calculator helps international investors understand all associated fees and costs when purchasing property abroad.

features.title: Why Choose Our Calculator
features.accurateDesc: Get precise fee estimates based on current rates and regulations
features.fastDesc: Calculate fees in seconds with our intelligent algorithm
features.transparentDesc: No hidden costs - see a complete breakdown of all fees

feature1.title: Know Your Eligibility Instantly
feature1.description: Get immediate feedback on whether FIRB approval is required based on your citizenship status, visa type, and property details. No guesswork, just clear answers.

feature2.title: Complete Cost Transparency
feature2.description: See every fee, tax, and cost associated with your property purchase. From FIRB application fees to stamp duty, ongoing costs, and more.
feature2.point1: FIRB fees calculated by property value
feature2.point3: Ongoing costs like land tax & insurance

feature3.title: Smart Investment Analytics
feature3.description: Understand your investment potential with detailed ROI projections, cash flow analysis, and equity growth forecasts over 10+ years.

howItWorks.title: How It Works
howItWorks.step1Desc: Provide the purchase price and property location
howItWorks.step2Desc: See a detailed breakdown of all applicable fees
howItWorks.step3Desc: Understand your total investment cost before committing

feesRequired.title: When Are These Fees Required?
feesRequired.subtitle: Foreign investment fees are required in specific circumstances when purchasing Australian residential property:

required.title: FIRB Fees Required
items: Foreign citizens purchasing any Australian residential property
Temporary residents buying established dwellings or vacant land
Non-residents making any residential property investment
Companies/trusts with foreign ownership purchasing residential property

notRequired.title: Fees NOT required if you are:
items: An Australian citizen or permanent resident
A New Zealand citizen with Special Category Visa (subclass 444)
A temporary resident buying a new dwelling to live in

firbApproval.title: When is FIRB Approval Required?
firbApproval.subtitle: Understanding the Foreign Investment Review Board (FIRB) approval process and requirements

whatIs.title: What is FIRB?
whatIs.content: The Foreign Investment Review Board (FIRB) is an Australian government body that reviews foreign investment proposals. Under the Foreign Acquisitions and Takeovers Act 1975, foreign persons must obtain FIRB approval before purchasing residential property in Australia.

timeline.title: Processing Timeline
timeline.standard: Standard applications take 30 days from receipt of complete application
timeline.expedited: Expedited processing available for additional fee (10 days)

steps.title: Apply Online
steps.description: Submit your application through the FIRB portal with property details and supporting documents

steps.title: Pay Application Fee
steps.description: Application fees range from $13,200 to $100,000+ based on property value

steps.title: Wait for Decision
steps.description: Standard processing takes 30 days. You'll receive a 'no objection' notification if approved

steps.title: Settle Property
steps.description: Complete your purchase within 12 months of approval and comply with all conditions

requirements.title: Key Requirements
items: Complete documentation including passport, visa, and property details
Compliance with approval conditions (e.g., primary residence for temporary residents)

penalties.title: Important: Penalties for Non-Compliance
penalties.warning: Purchasing without FIRB approval when required is a serious offence with severe penalties:
items: Fines up to $3.3 million for individuals
Criminal prosecution with up to 10 years imprisonment
Loss of capital gains and future approval difficulties

cta.title: Ready to Verify Your Investment?
cta.subtitle: Get instant calculations of all fees and costs associated with your Australian property investment.

company.name: Property Fee Calculator
company.description: Helping international investors understand Australian property investment costs with accurate, transparent calculations.

disclaimer.text: Disclaimer: This calculator provides estimates only and should not be considered financial or legal advice. Fees, regulations, and requirements are subject to change. Always consult with qualified professionals including immigration lawyers, tax advisors, and licensed conveyancers before making property investment decisions. We are not affiliated with FIRB or any Australian government agency.

FIRBCalculator.title: FIRB Calculator
FIRBCalculator.description: Calculate your complete property investment costs including FIRB fees, stamp duty, and ongoing expenses

citizenship.title: Citizenship Status
citizenship.description: Tell us about your citizenship status to determine your eligibility and requirements

australian.title: Australian Citizen
australian.description: Born in Australia or naturalized Australian citizen

permanent.title: Permanent Resident
permanent.description: Hold a permanent residence visa (subclass 100, 189, 190, etc.)

temporary.title: Temporary Resident
temporary.description: Hold a temporary visa (student, work, partner visa)

foreign.title: Foreign Person
foreign.description: Do not hold Australian citizenship or residency

visaType.label: What type of visa do you hold?

ordinaril yResident.label: I am ordinarily resident in Australia
ordinaril yResident.description: You live in Australia and it is your permanent home (even if temporarily overseas)

info.australian: As an Australian citizen ordinarily resident, you generally have no restrictions on property purchases and no FIRB approval required.
info.permanent: As a permanent resident, you have the same property rights as Australian citizens with no FIRB approval required.
info.temporary: As a temporary resident, you can purchase new dwellings for use as your principal place of residence. FIRB approval is required.
info.foreign: As a foreign person, you can purchase new dwellings or vacant land for development. FIRB approval is mandatory for all purchases.

property.title: Property Details
property.description: Provide information about the property you're considering

newDwelling.title: New Dwelling
newDwelling.description: Brand new property or off-the-plan purchase

firstHome.label: I am a first home buyer
firstHome.description: You may be eligible for stamp duty concessions

property.entityDescription: The legal entity that will own the property

review.title: Review Your Information
review.description: Please review your details before calculating

eligible.title: Eligible to Purchase
eligible.firbRequired: FIRB approval is required before you can proceed with the purchase
eligible.noFirbRequired: You can proceed without FIRB approval

notEligible.title: Purchase Restrictions Apply
notEligible.description: Based on your citizenship status, you may not be eligible to purchase this type of property

summary.title: Summary
summary.description: A technical assessment of your eligibility based on citizenship status and property type

approval.requiredDesc: You are eligible to apply for foreign investment approval
approval.notRequiredDesc: You can proceed with your property purchase without FIRB approval
approval.prohibitedDesc: You are not eligible to purchase this property type

restrictions.title: Restrictions & Requirements
restrictions.description: Important conditions that apply to your purchase

costs.title: Investment Cost Breakdown
costs.description: Detailed breakdown of all costs associated with your property purchase

disclaimer.title: Important Disclaimer
disclaimer.content: This calculator provides estimates only and should not be considered financial or legal advice. Actual costs may vary. FIRB regulations are subject to change. We strongly recommend consulting with qualified professionals including lawyers, accountants, and FIRB specialists before making any property investment decisions.

toggle.title: Investment Analysis & Projections
toggle.description: See rental yields, ROI, 10-year projections, cash flow analysis, and compare against other investments

summary.title: Investment Performance Summary
summary.description: Key metrics at a glance based on your investment assumptions

inputs.title: Investment Analysis Parameters
inputs.description: Adjust these values to see how different scenarios affect your investment returns
inputs.note: These are estimates based on current market conditions and your assumptions. Actual returns may vary. Calculations update in real-time as you adjust values.

rental.title: Rental Income Details
rental.vacancyHelp: Typical: 3-5% for good locations, 7-10% for high-risk areas

management.title: Property Management
management.selfManaged: I will self-manage this property (no management fees)

assumptions.title: Investment Assumptions
assumptions.holdPeriodHelp: How long do you plan to hold this investment?

currency.title: Currency Conversion (Optional)
currency.exchangeHelp: Update with current exchange rate from your bank or xe.com

cashFlow.title: Cash Flow Analysis
cashFlow.description: Annual rental income vs expenses and loan repayments

projections.title: {years}-Year Projection
projections.description: Property value, loan balance, and equity growth over time

comparison.title: Investment Comparison
comparison.description: Compare property investment returns vs other asset classes over {years} years
comparison.propertyLeadsDesc: Based on your assumptions, property investment outperforms all other options with a {return} total return ({rate} annualized).
comparison.comparisonDesc: {best} shows higher returns ({return}) under these assumptions. Property investment returns {propertyReturn}.
comparison.assumptions: Assumptions: Property at {growth}% growth, ASX 200 at 7.2%, bonds/deposits at 4-4.5%. Property includes rental income and tax benefits. Past performance doesn't guarantee future returns.

sensitivity.title: Sensitivity Analysis
sensitivity.description: How different scenarios impact your investment returns
sensitivity.warningDesc: These scenarios show how changes in key variables affect your returns. Consider these risks when making your investment decision.
sensitivity.vacancyNote: Each 5% increase in vacancy reduces cash flow by ~${amount}/year
sensitivity.interestNote: Each 1% interest rate increase costs ~${amount}/month more

sensitivityItems.capitalGrowth: Capital growth rate (biggest impact on returns)
sensitivityItems.interestRate: Interest rate changes (affects monthly cash flow)

taxAnalysis.title: Tax Analysis
taxAnalysis.description: Tax deductions, negative gearing benefits, and CGT on exit
taxAnalysis.deductionsDesc: Annual deductible expenses against rental income
taxAnalysis.taxPlanningTip: Tax Planning Tip: Foreign residents don't receive the 50% CGT discount. Consider obtaining permanent residency before selling to significantly reduce CGT liability. Consult a tax professional for personalized advice.

score.title: Investment Score & Recommendation
score.description: AI-generated assessment based on comprehensive analysis

emailModal.title: Email Your Results
emailModal.description: Enter your email address to receive a copy of your FIRB calculation results
emailModal.consentLabel: I consent to receive my calculation results via email
emailModal.consentDescription: We will only use your email to send you the requested results. We do not share your information with third parties.
emailModal.info: You will receive a detailed PDF report with your complete cost breakdown and eligibility information.

success.title: Email Sent Successfully!
success.description: Check your inbox for your FIRB calculation results.

errors.required: Please fill in all required fields
